name: Grand Vista Hanoi
detail: Rooms are spacious and brand new. Breakfast was standard, was surprised only black coffee was offered for the buffet

name: Roygent Parks Hanoi
detail: The hotel is very very good. Cater mostly for Japanese customer, you can expect they have their room to the best of quality. The only down-side it that it seem to be far from many things like restaurants or a park to scroll along, or those little lakes that dot Hanoi. All in, good.

name: Fortuna Hotel Hanoi
detail: The service is exemplary and this is one of the few hotels in Hanoi that I can safely recommend. The staff is geniuinely friendly and helpgul. The breakfast is the best out of the dozen or so hotel I have stayed in Hanoi. The internet is stable and signal is strong. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. A full spread of amenities can be found whether for business or relaxation.

name: Oakwood Residence Hanoi
detail: Helpful and exceptionally friendly staff with a well-designed layout and luxury amenities (esp. the swimming pool and gym). Very good value for money in terms of service apartments and business hotels in Hanoi.
area: Tay Ho District,Hanoi - View on map

name: Melia Hanoi Hotel
detail: There are many hotels listed in Hanoi. If you are on a limited budget or a backpacker, you can choose from hundreds in the old quarter. That's fine if you like no windows or noisy environments. Local knowledge is invaluable and a friend in Hanoi said there was only one area to stay and that is in the embassy areas. Melia offered a great deal on Agoda for a deluxe room. It's in a great area in the city so you can walk to the Opera and museums and there are a wealth of western-style eateries, coffee shops with free wifi etc. So, location is fabulous. Check-in was efficient and fast. My deluxe room was finished well but an old tv and no DVD spoiled it somewhat. At this price point, a plasma and DVD should be considered mandatory. WiFi/internet is supplied for a price. Would a hotel provide a room without a TV nowadays? Of course not, so why this silly idea that internet is not required? Why do many hotels still think it is ok to charge for an essential service? Let me say it loudly so that hotel managements hear this: we want internet in our rooms and elsewhere in the hotel and it should be provided for free at a five star hotel. The Melia is everything a five star establishment should be: courteous, efficient staff, lovely spacious reception area/lobby, fast lifts (elevators to our US friends), lovely pool at a gorgeous temperature (but silly towel policy whereby you can arrive to the pool area and find no towels and have to go back inside to the health club and sign for one (!!!). This is just a silly policy that needs changing. Towels should be available at the pool where you use them. The health club was very impressive with lots of programmes offered for those who go for that sort of thing. Breakfast offered a huge selection (my booking included breakfast for two)
area: Hoan Kiem District,Hanoi - View on map

name: Champton Hanoi Hotel
detail: Family of 4 with 2 children 13 and 11 we booked 2 rooms and they put us on different levels not sure why but we made it work the rooms are very small but nice and clean and comfortable it was our first time in Hanoi so not sure if all hotels are like this We booked this hotel because it was one of the only hotels in Hanoi we could find with a swimming pool . The pool itâ€™s self was great just a little small but lucky enough the few times we had a swim no one was there so it worked out great for us. The breakfast was really good we expected a small choice for a small hotel but it was great lots to choose from and nice food. The staff were very attentive and we had a early flight in the morning and even packed us all a breakfast bag to take with us. If staying in Hanoi again we will stay here again very happy
area: Hoan Kiem District,Hanoi - View on map

name: Lotte Hotel Hanoi
detail: My experience with Lotte Hotel Hanoi has been nothing short of perfect ever since I made the decision to book a room. Everyone at the hotel seems to go out of their way to make your special occasion even better. As soon as I got to the hotel I was blown away by the view. It's one thing to imagine it but it's another thing altogether to get, what is perhaps, the best view in Hanoi from what might be the most luxurious hotel in Hanoi. The service is absolutely impeccable from everyone in the hotel but I do need to specially point out Ms. Ngan, Mr. Dat Tan Nguyen and every one of the Reservation Sales Agents I talked to for doing an exceptional job. They go out of their way to ensure you have the best time possible.

name: Hanoi Daewoo Hotel
detail: Given my first time iN Vietnam, I was worried about the cleanliness of the hotels. So I booked in Sheraton Hanoi for 2 days and then moved around the countries and when decided to fly back to Hanoi I was searching for another 5 star hotel since Sheraton was fully booked on that day and I found few 5 star hotels like Lotte and sofitel but but I found that Hanoi daewoo hotel is a five star hotel with a very good price and close to the biggest mall in Hanoi so decided to give it a try and to be frank it has exceeded my expectation

name: Carillon Boutique Hotel
detail: Very close to train station, Bahn Mi 25 and night market.

name: Grand Plaza Hotel Hanoi
detail: compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it. compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it. compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it. compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it.
